Package com.abcodeworks.webshortcututil.write

Provides classes for creating web shortcut files

See:
          Description

Class Summary
DesktopShortcutWriter Writes Desktop shortcuts (FreeDesktop shortcuts with a .desktop extension - used by Linux, etc.).
ShortcutWriter Parent class for writers.
UrlShortcutWriter Writes URL shortcuts (Windows shortcuts with a .url extension).
WeblocBinaryShortcutWriter Writes Webloc Binary shortcuts (Apple/Mac/OSX shortcuts with a .webloc extension).
WeblocShortcutWriter Parent class for the Webloc writers.
WeblocXmlShortcutWriter Writes Webloc XML shortcuts (Apple/Mac/OSX shortcuts with a .webloc extension).
 

Exception Summary
FileAlreadyExistsException Used to indicate that a file already exists.
ShortcutWriteException Used to indicate when there is an exception writing a shortcut file or stream.
 

Package com.abcodeworks.webshortcututil.write Description

Provides classes for creating web shortcut files

To create a shortcut you first need to instantiate the appropriate writer class ( DesktopShortcutReader UrlShortcutReader, WeblocBinaryShortcutWriter, or WeblocXmlShortcutWriter). If you want to create a file, call the write method. You can use the createFilename method to generate a file name. It takes the provided base file name, adds the appropriate extension, and removes any special characters in the name. The generated file name should be compatible with most operating systems. If you need to write the shortcut to a stream, use the write method. A usage example follows: 

 import com.abcodeworks.webshortcututil.write.ShortcutWriter;
 import com.abcodeworks.webshortcututil.write.DesktopShortcutWriter;
 import com.abcodeworks.webshortcututil.write.UrlShortcutWriter;
 import com.abcodeworks.webshortcututil.write.WeblocBinaryShortcutWriter;
 import com.abcodeworks.webshortcututil.write.WeblocXmlShortcutWriter;
 
 ShortcutWriter writer = new DesktopShortcutWriter();
    OR
 ShortcutWriter writer = new UrlShortcutWriter();
    OR
 ShortcutWriter writer = new WeblocBinaryShortcutWriter();
    OR
 ShortcutWriter writer = new WeblocXmlShortcutWriter();
 
 String name = "My Shortcut";
 String url = "http://myurl.com/";
 
 String filename = writer.createFilename(name);
 File file = new File(path, filename);
 writer.write(file, name, url);

Note that you have two options when creating a Webloc shortcut: binary or XML format. They both are recognized by OSX. Also note that there is no way to create a Website shortcut. This is due to the complexity of the file format. If you want to generate a Windows-compatible shortcut, use UrlShortcutReader.

The methods that write to streams will automatically close the streams when finished with them.
